Shelling in Syria kills 17

Activists said Syrian troops shelled the city of Daraa today, killing at least 17 people, in yet another blow to an international peace plan. (AP, 11:19 a.m.)
  • Corpses found in Syrian hamlet

Maria Sharapova wins French Open title

Maria Sharapova defeated Sara Errani today to win the French Open title, becoming the 10th woman to win a career Grand Slam. (AP, 12:59 p.m.)

Obama campaign woos Hispanics

With Spanish ads in highly contested states, President Obama aims to shore up what polls show is a large lead over Mitt Romney among Hispanics. (AP, 12:29 p.m.)

Taunton to vote on $500m tribal casino

If approved, the referendum would mark the first time residents have expressed support for a casino plan since passage of the state's new gambling law. (AP, 11:28 a.m.)
